The 2019-2020 Plastic Film Recycling Challenge officially begins November 15!

MCS Secondary and Elementary School will be competing against each other, as well as surrounding schools in the County. The Challenge will run from November 15 - April 15.

The purpose of the challenge is to....

Recover plastic film, which cannot be recycled through regular curbside recycling programs in order to keep it out of our region‚Äôs landfill.

Teach others that plastic film CANNOT be placed in curbside recycling bins, but CAN be delivered back to any grocery store and various other retailers in NYS.

Items include: Grocery bags, bread bags, wood pellet bags, sandwich bags, any type of plastic that stretches.

Please do not include: Pet food bags, frozen produce bags, any type of hard plastic!

Items can be delivered to the Elementary School or Secondary Bin in the MCS lobby.

For a complete list of items that can be recycled, please go to the Morris Central School webpage, under Plastic Film Recycling Challenge, or contact Heather Grant at hgrant@morriscsd.org
